mods.abstract: $50 REWARD--Ranaway from the subscriber on board the steamer Osceola, about 5 o'clock on the evening of the 1st inst. a bright Mulatto man named PRINCE, about 30 years of age, about 6 feet high, stout, heavy set, high forehead, speaks quick when spoken to. Had on when he left a dark summer coat, pale blue cotton pants, and an old fur cap. The above named boy was seen soon after he left, on St. Charles street, between Julia and St. Joseph streets, where his mother is now living. Any person who will arrest and secure him, so that I get him again, shall receive the above reward. All persons are warned not to harbor or employ him. Steamboat officers and ship masters are also warned not to carry him off. Any information addressed to me, at Nashville, Tenn., or Dr. C.H. DABBS, Munroe, La., or J.H. Moore, No. 107 Poydras street, this city, respecting him will be thankfully received. HENRY B. DABBS. jy13 3t*
mods.note: seen on St. Charles street, New Orleans
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
